qas.question: What state made the smallest contribution to the revolutionary war of any state?
How many men from NC joined the continental army?
What years were the highest concentration of military action in NC during the revolutionary war?
Frontiersmen from the Carolinas moved west into what area that is now known as Tennessee?

context: <a0_0>North Carolina<a0_0/> made the smallest per-capita contribution to the war of any state, as only <a1_0>7,800<a1_0/> men joined the Continental Army under <a2_0>General George Washington<a2_0/>; an additional 10,000 served in local militia units under such leaders as General Nathanael Greene. There was some military action, especially in <a3_0>1780–81<a3_0/>. Many Carolinian frontiersmen had moved west over the mountains, into the <a4_0>Washington District<a4_0/> (later known as Tennessee), but in 1789, following the Revolution, the state was persuaded to relinquish its claim to the western lands. It ceded them to the national government so that the Northwest Territory could be organized and managed nationally.
